title: The Mouth That Counted the Universe
hook: In the beginning, there was nothing but a single horizontal line, until a hungry Mouth appeared.
absurdist: The Mouth tries to eat the number Ten but chokes, coughing up the Sun (Day) and Moon (Month).

title: The Ancient Singer of Dawn
hook: Before there was music, an ancient fool with wild whiskers opened his mouth and invented singing.
callbacks: Daybreak recalls Month from Lesson 1
Stomach recalls Eye from Lesson 1
absurdist: The singer's Stomach grumbles so loud at Daybreak it bends the earth into concave and convex shapes.

title: The Emperor of Measurement
hook: The Emperor loved himself so much he tried to measure his own tongue.
callbacks: Tongue recalls Eye from Lesson 1
absurdist: The Emperor swallows a Pill to rise up, but just floats above and below his throne while people ridicule him.

title: The Shellfish Economy
hook: In this strange land, money isn't gold; it's stubborn shellfish.
callbacks: Shellfish becomes the currency that buys Tribute in Lesson 5
absurdist: The Employee is paid in Ladles of Shellfish, which he pastes to his forehead.

title: The Workshop of Blades
hook: The Older Brother set up a shop to sell tools, but he only knew how to make things sharp.
callbacks: Sword here will arm the Army in Lesson 14
absurdist: The Older Brother bribes a Sword to cut a Tribute, but the Sword just stings him instead.

title: The Child Who Roared
hook: The second child was not good; in fact, he was a piercing headache.
callbacks: child recalls Older Brother from Lesson 5
absurdist: The Child roars into a cavity so loud it pierces the Mother's patience.

title: The Battle of Stones and Rays
hook: The small stone stared at the vast sun and whispered: 'One day, I will shine like you.'
callbacks: stone and Gravel foreshadow the Mountain in Lesson 23
absurdist: The Stone tries to peel itself to resemble a Ray of light but just becomes strange Gravel.

title: The Flood and the Fire
hook: The Water and the Fire had a truce, until the River got drunk on Juice.
callbacks: Dawn recalls Month from Lesson 1
Sand recalls stone from Lesson 7
absurdist: The Fish gets a Fever and tries to extinguish the Fire by spitting Juice.

title: The Black Ink Banquet
hook: In a cave buried a thousand Li away, they hold a banquet where you eat only ink.
callbacks: Nighttime recalls Month from Lesson 1
absurdist: The wealthy guest tries to mail a Banquet through a cave but buries it in Black Ink instead.

title: The Forest of Dim-Witted Trees
hook: Not all forests are wise; this one is full of dim-witted apricot trees.
callbacks: younger sister recalls Older Brother from Lesson 5
absurdist: The dim-witted Tree tries to dye a Table with Foam but just creates a Flavor of Suffering.

title: The Dog Who Cried Peach
hook: A remarkable dog discovered a portent: the sky was raining peaches.
callbacks: Dog returns as a crazy companion in Lesson 12
absurdist: The Dog cries so hard that Peaches fall from the sky, and the Cow declares this a Portent of Stinking times ahead.

title: The King's Golden Balls
hook: The King introduced a new game to the world involving jade, tea, and insanity.
callbacks: Lord recalls Dynasty from Lesson 3
Copper recalls Shellfish from Lesson 4
absurdist: The Emperor goes crazy and tries to go fishin' using a Gold Needle and Jade Balls as bait.

title: The Lotus Car Chase
hook: The Tao (Way) is usually peaceful, but today it involves a speedy car chase.
callbacks: Car from here races again in the Army's transport in Lesson 14
absurdist: The Guest drives a Car made of Lotus flowers to L.A. but shears off his own forehead in a crash.

title: The Soldier's Dream of Capital
hook: The superfluous army marched toward the capital, carrying nothing but a dream.
callbacks: Crown recalls Dynasty from Lesson 3
absurdist: The Soldier tries to buy a lucky Crown but falls into a profound Pit of ripe fruit.

title: The Police Poet
hook: The most dangerous weapon in the precinct wasn't the gun — it was Officer Chen's poetry book.
callbacks: Prison here foreshadows the Prisoner of Lesson 26
absurdist: The Police read a Poem so terrible it sends the burglar to Prison out of pure awkwardness.

title: The Iron Burglar
hook: The Iron City had never been robbed. Then again, nobody had tried wearing the city as a hat.
callbacks: Coin recalls Shellfish from Lesson 4
War here ends with the Politics of Lesson 17
absurdist: The Burglar tries to steal a City but it's too laden with Iron, so he just steals a cheap Coin instead.

title: The Political Footstep
hook: Politics is just a series of footsteps that lead nowhere correct.
callbacks: Foundation here becomes the Base of Lesson 45
absurdist: The Military general tries to ford a river of Politics but steps on a Levy and falls in.

title: The Day the Sky Wore Clothes
hook: Someone had to dress the sky, and only one tailor was foolish enough to try.
callbacks: Sovereign recalls Dynasty from Lesson 3
Thunder recalls to illuminate from Lesson 8
absurdist: The Sky puts on a Hat made of Clouds and Thunder, but it's too tight and causes Rain.

title: The Mirror of Absurdity
hook: When the blind scholar looked into the mirror, he saw not his face but a rhyme that had been dead for centuries.
callbacks: Mirror here reflects the Sound that becomes Voice in Lesson 50
absurdist: The blind man looks into the Mirror and unexpectedly sees a Rhyme undressing.

title: The Snake's Egg Breakfast
hook: She went to the pond to find breakfast but found a serpent mocking her.
callbacks: Ground recalls stone from Lesson 7
Sheep recalls Cow from Lesson 11
absurdist: The Serpent wraps a Sheep in Bubbles and tries to vend it as fresh Soup.

title: The Factory of Forgetfulness
hook: In a factory trapped inside a solid country, workers make trousers out of hemp and regret.
callbacks: Heart recalls Eye from Lesson 1
Heart here learns to forget; it will remember in Lesson 39 with Feelings
absurdist: The busy worker forgets his Trousers in the Warehouse and has to wear a Bed of Hemp.

title: A Hand's Violent Day
hook: The hand woke up and chose violence, then love, then confusion.
callbacks: Finger recalls Eye from Lesson 1
Hand's actions create the History that Lesson 33 will teach
absurdist: The Hand grabs a Vegetable and combs it with a Claw until it flows with Milk.

title: The Secret Valley of Bathing
hook: Deep in the mountain, there is a secret valley where bears go to bathe.
callbacks: Valley recalls stone from Lesson 7
absurdist: The Pine Tree, impoverished and desperate for a bath, dissolves completely into the Valley, leaving only its Desire behind.

title: The Old Woman's Political Party
hook: An Old Woman started a political party based on quilts and malicious gossip.
callbacks: Ear recalls Eye from Lesson 1
Husband from here becomes Father in Lesson 33
absurdist: The Feudal Official loses his Ear in a Quilt and enacts a Law against sleeping.

title: The Committee of Rice and Riddles
hook: The committee met in the autumn to discuss the serious business of perfume and riddles.
callbacks: Bamboo recalls Forest from Lesson 10
Rice from here feeds the Meal of Lesson 37
absurdist: The Committee gets lost in a Box of Bamboo Rice and has to answer a Riddle to get out.

title: The Prisoner's Furniture Store
hook: A prisoner escaped and opened a furniture store, but he only sold chairs to himself.
callbacks: Prisoner escapes to become the Criminal of Lesson 36
absurdist: The Prisoner eats rotten Meat from a Bag while sitting upside down on his Furniture.

title: The Court of Night Liquids
hook: In the Royal Court, they don't drink wine; they drink the liquid of the night.
callbacks: Night recalls Month from Lesson 1
Night Liquid becomes the Liquor of Lesson 37
absurdist: The Associate tries to piece together his Spine using Night Liquid.

title: The Corpse's Vacation
hook: The corpse packed light for his vacation: one saw, one nun, and a change of woolen cloth.
absurdist: The Corpse goes swimming in Mud wearing Woolen Cloth and hires a Nun to wash him.

title: The God of Oil and Fruit
hook: The gods demanded a sacrifice, but all we had was oil and fruit.
callbacks: Fruit here grows into the Plum of Lesson 10 (echoed forward)
absurdist: The Priest scrubs the Front of his Garment with Oil to worship the Fruit God.

title: The Sugar War
hook: The Sugar War began when Queen Elizabeth's skirt dissolved in the rain.
absurdist: Queen Elizabeth wears a Skirt made of Sugar and sweeps the Snow with a Big Dipper.

title: The Fat General's Makeup
hook: The General was robust, but he needed a lot of makeup to hide his mistakes.
callbacks: General here commands the Troops of Lesson 34
absurdist: The Fat General puts on Makeup to look like a robust Hamlet but just looks like a weary Cup.

title: The Wisdom of the Dart
hook: The tribe's elders threw away their spears. 'Wisdom,' they declared, 'is sharper than any dart.'
absurdist: The Younger Brother tries to shoot a Bullet with a Bow but hits the Buddha instead.

title: The Pig Teacher
hook: The teacher was a pig, but he taught the most important lesson of all: how to roast.
callbacks: Father recalls Older Brother from Lesson 5
Pig recalls Cow from Lesson 11
absurdist: The Pig Teacher chases a Lion around the School until they both slip on a Skeleton.

title: Apollo's Hole
hook: Apollo stood at the edge of the hole and laughed. 'The moon?' he said. 'The moon is boring.'
absurdist: Apollo falls abruptly into a deep Hole and finds a Spy researching empty stairs.

title: The Spider's Red Web
hook: The spider spun a web not of silk, but of red medicine and machines.
callbacks: Silk weaves into the Clothing legacy of Lesson 18
absurdist: The Chicken weaves a Net of Green Silk to catch a Machine that dispenses Medicine.

title: The Frozen Collar
hook: It was so cold that his collar froze to his neck, and his fate was sealed.
callbacks: Foot recalls Eye from Lesson 1
absurdist: The Criminal's Collar freezes to a Willow tree at exactly zero degrees, and he must chat his way to freedom.

title: The Drunken Drummer
hook: After his third cup, the Chieftain decided his head made a better drumstick than his hands.
callbacks: Head recalls Eye from Lesson 1
Silver recalls Shellfish from Lesson 4
absurdist: Mom gets drunk on Liquor and plays the Drum with a Silver Heel while eating Beans.

title: The Spicy Vendor
hook: The vendor sold spicy hammer soup, and he was very diligent about it.
callbacks: Heat here ignites the Fire memory from Lesson 8
absurdist: The Tot carves a Nucleus out of a Spicy Fowl using a Hammer while shouting 'Ooh!'.

title: The Poisonous Spring
hook: In the spring, the flowers don't bloom; they just release refined poison.
callbacks: Springtime recalls the early morning of Lesson 2
absurdist: The Diligent Vendor hits his own Eyeball with a Cudgel and falls asleep at his Stand.

title: The Cowboy's Ticket to the West
hook: The cowboy's ticket said SOUTH. His heart said WEST. His waist said nothing — it was just sore from riding.
callbacks: Merchant recalls Shellfish from Lesson 4
absurdist: The Merchant writes 'WEST' on his Ticket in Smoke, but the wind keeps blowing it back to 'SOUTH'.

title: The Gun in the Storehouse
hook: They opened the storehouse to find not grain, but a gun and a marquis.
callbacks: Gun foreshadows the Bullet of Lesson 32
absurdist: The Marquis uses Chopsticks to defend the Gun from a Tanned Hide.

title: The Spicy Trunk
hook: The tree trunk was so spicy that even the drought couldn't dry it out.
callbacks: Drought recalls Water's eternal struggle from Lesson 8
absurdist: Yu hurries to bundle up the Spicy Trunk but collides with a Heavy Species of ant.

title: The Insane Physician
hook: In the asylum's west wing, there was a physician who cured nothing but caused everything.
absurdist: The Physician sends a glowing Lamp to Europe as 'Evidence' of a cure, but it's really just a way to discard his Insane ideas.

title: The Shadow Puppets of England
hook: In England, the shadows don't follow you; they tumble and wrestle.
callbacks: Shadow recalls the Night of Lesson 27
absurdist: Papa grasps a Mosquito in the Center of England and repairs it with Literature.

title: The Sweet Dance of Nothing
hook: The dance was sweet, but the partner was nothing but a ghost.
callbacks: Ancestor connects to the Generation of Lesson 2
absurdist: The Sphinx tries to Comfort the Ancestor with a Sweet Dance but trips over the Base.

title: The Universal Port
hook: The port was open to everyone, provided they chose the right lane.
absurdist: Ten thousand workers stand side by side, each choosing a different Lane, yet somehow all arriving at the same Port.

title: The Well of Evil Angles
hook: They lowered a bucket into the well and pulled up: an evil angle, a flat wheel, and a very confused canon.
absurdist: The Evil Angle tries to untie the Wheel but gets flattened by a heavy Canon.

title: The Paper Marriage
hook: Their marriage was only on paper, and the paper was made of dusk.
callbacks: Marriage echoes the family bonds of Lesson 6
absurdist: The Young Man wrestles a Metropolis made of Paper until it collapses into an Echo.

title: The Boat of Illusions
hook: The boat existed only as long as you believed in it. The orphan believed very, very hard.
absurdist: The Orphan relocates a Melon on a Boat but realizes the boat is just a forged Word.

title: The Shrimp's Vacation
hook: Even shrimp need a vacation, preferably one with shoes and steam.
callbacks: Voice echoes the Sound first heard in Lesson 19
absurdist: The Shrimp wears Leather Shoes to fly face-to-face with a bowl of steaming Noodles.

title: The Fur House
hook: The house was made entirely of fur, which made the broadcasting very muffled.
callbacks: Tail recalls the Dog from Lesson 11
absurdist: The Fur Dwelling swells up like a balloon and floats away during a Funeral.

title: The Hawk and the Rabbit
hook: The hawk met a rabbit on an island, and they discussed the concept of ten thousand.
callbacks: Bird recalls Cow from Lesson 11
Bird recalls the Fowl of Lesson 38
absurdist: The Rabbit rides an Elephant to avoid the Hawk but gets stuck on a Ridge of a Hill.

title: The Mama Tiger's Drama
hook: Mama was a tiger, and she loved drama almost as much as she loved scolding.
callbacks: Mama recalls Older Brother from Lesson 5
Tiger recalls Cow from Lesson 11
absurdist: Mama rides a Tiger into a pile of Dust to check if the Deer has a Drama Certificate.

title: The Dragon's Morning Farm
hook: The dragon had given up fire-breathing years ago. Now he farmed ghost-lumps every morning, like his father before him.
callbacks: Morning recalls Month from Lesson 1
Dragon recalls Cow from Lesson 11
absurdist: The Dragon delivers a concentrated Lump of Ghost farming to the Morning market.

title: The Youngster and the Chaos Dragon
hook: A youngster wrote a spell so old and false that it opened a window to pure chaos.
callbacks: Chaos swallows all that Genesis created in Lesson 1
absurdist: The Clown twists a Multistory Building into a vertical Orchid to relieve his Diarrhea.
